intro: Staurogyne rosulata, commonly known as the Rosulate Staurogyne, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Staurogyne rosulata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to purify water in aquatic environments.
